comment: Loved taking her online. Everything was organized and clear, and the workloads were never heavy. Tests were open notes and only a discussion post every other week. She is very reachable if something ever comes up, she's very understanding. Definitely take her if you want to learn, and it is simple and easy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Accessible outside class

comment: Open note quizzes and easy to follow lectures. This class wasn't rough at all. Take her! She's also a very nice person.

She is absolutely wonderful. I am in her online summer course, and although I was nervous because of the faster pace, Dr. LeFebvre has made this course ridiculously easy to navigate. There are two modules a week, usually adding up to two quizzes and a discussion post. Everything is clearly explained and plenty of time to complete. Would take again!

Dr. LeFebvre's online class was very straightforward, and to the point. There's weekly quizzes and biweekly discussion posts. The midterm and final exams are open note, which is good. TAKE NOTES and read the textbook when you can so you don't have to cram like how I did smh. Organized notes makes this class wayyyy easier. Great class overall :)
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Online Savvy

comment: Worst Professor I have had in three years. Very confusing... gives criteria for grading then grades on something completely different.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Class consists of discussions and quizzes. Everything is open note and can be found in the textbook. There are also short video lectures you can watch instead of reading the textbook.

This class was pretty easy honestly I just didn't apply myself as much as I should've. I would definitely recommend her. Her quizzes are easy if you read and she also offers an extra credit assignment that gives you 3% added to your final grade.

She's nice but assigns so much work that a lot of time is needed for this class per week, more than I'd say should be for a gen ed. The majority of her questions are from the given material but her wording is tricky (I got marked off for so many questions that were definitely not wrong). Work load is heavy but doable, I'd avoid though honestly.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: One of the worst Professors ever and I am not sure as to why her rating is so high. She literally only gave us 90 minutes on the midterm and final exam both had 35 multiple choice, 4 matching and three 2 paragraph essays. Not enough time AT ALL and she will take off points if your answers are less than 2 paragraphs. Trust me, avoid her class
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Test heavy

comment: You have a quiz once a week and sometimes a discussion post too. Tests are very hard, but every test and quiz is open note and open book. Professor Lefebvre is easy to get in contact with and is very helpful. However, if you miss an assignment, she will not allow you to make it up without a doctor's excuse. Overall, pretty good experience.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Accessible outside class

comment: Not a bad class, no lockdown browser or webcam.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Great professor! Powerpoint slides are basic and straight to the point. You have a weekly quiz which are open note. 2 papers throughout the semester but are called Op-eds, fairly easy. As long as you take notes her test are easy because they are open book. Each week its a group activity, must be leader at least once through semester for credit.

Professor Lefebvre is the best! Each week theres either a quiz or discussion posting. The class only has quizzes, a midterm and a final all of which are open notes. Most questions from the quizzes are from her video lectures and a only a few from the textbook( to make sure youre reading) if you can take her take her. ALL OPEN NOTE!!!!

I loved this class! It was really easy. Two quizzes a week plus a discussion post. The quizzes are open note and really easy as long as you read the materials given. lots of reading.!!! Two writing assignments and she was a pretty lenient grader! Cant wait to take more classes with this professor!

Easily accessible professor. Straightforward course list and expectations. Textbook: very important. She can skim a bit on points, but feel free to reach out to her if you want an explanation. One full paper, a few 15 minute (open note but def. prepare) quizzes, 2 discussions, and annoying video app. papers. Open-note tests too. Prepare, work hard.
Great lectures and would take her again!

Online student here. Rebecca is a very fair teacher that includes work load and grading style. She grades modestly and wants sufficient work, no need to go above and beyond like other teachers. Midterm, quizzes, and final exam all open note. An A is very feasible but you cannot miss an assignment. She only accepts late papers, anything else is 0.
Very good professor, she is also very sweet and always responds to emails on time. I highly recommend taking her you will not regret it.

everything (even midterm and final) was open book, open notes. I HIGHLY recommend taking her if you are only in political science because its a required course because she makes everything so easy and the workload is not heavy. it's not nothing but it is reasonable for a 1000 level class that everyone is required to take. helpful prof too if needed
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Caring

comment: Professor LeFebvre is a great professor. I took her online during the summer and she made the class really easy and fun. There were a lot of papers but they were small and not to difficult. I would definitely recommend her.
Every week you either have to do a discussion post, paper, or quiz. She can grade a little harshly on the papers. Overall, the class was good and the workload was definitely manageable.

Dr. LeFebvre is a great professor. I took this as an online class. You have one assignment each week, it is either a quiz or short paper. Every quiz and exam is open book, but you have a shorter amount of time to finish the quiz. If you don't prepare and study for the open note quizzes and exams you won't do well. I definitely recommend the class.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Took this class online over the summer. Easy A, very little work. Everything is open note. There are 2 quizzes/simulations every week, and two tests, both of which are easy due to them being open note. Lectures were pretty interesting as well. Great class to get this credit out of the way.

I didn't buy the textbook for this class and I was fine. There are a couple of module quizzes where you do need it though. There's notes and a quiz every week. Only 2 projects which are easy. Midterm and final were easy and you can use your notes and book so make sure you take notes every week. Extra credit really helped my grade.

She was an awesome professor! She does not require much, just a discussion/quiz on a video every week, on top of a weekly test. There is a practice test & a graded test so there is no reason you can't ace every test. The class was laid back & didn't stress me out, which allowed me to focus on other classes. She is clear in her grading... take her!

This is my second class I took with Dr. Lefebre. She is very clear in what she wants done. I took this class over the summer and it was much like her spring course. At least 1 assignment every week, usually due on Saturdays. You need to listen to her lectures and everything will be answered from there. Midterm was hard, Final was easier.

AMAZING!! I took her for 2 semesters in a row (POLS 2250 and POLS 2401 both online) and I absolutely love her. I've received a A in both classes, BUT you have to put in work for an A. I didn't need to buy the textbook for any classes, just read the powerpoints and anything she provided! An amazing person and teacher!
If she is available to take then register for her immediate. She has extremely clear grading criteria, straight forward quizzes and tests, and gives extra credit. Easy A if you do all the work.

Her online gov class is pretty straight-forward. Every week you have a lecture to listen to followed by an online quiz asking questions based on what you learned from the lesson or a discussion board asking for students to research something based on the weekly topic. It's an easy A as everything is open note (mid-term and final included).

You'll either have a quiz or a discussion every week, quizzes and tests are all open notes. There are also 2 somewhat tedious projects, they're not difficult but will take you time to do and she grades them hard. Everything is laid out at the beginning of the semester so you know what you need to do. Not great, not horrible-fairly easy A.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Really nice and great with communication. She lays out all your work at the beginning of the semester. Just make sure you don't miss deadlines - but everything is due on Saturday by midnight. Not a heavy workload - and don't buy the book - you don't need it.

She is a good teacher. There is a lot of reading, discussions and quizzes but it's not as difficult as it seems. She is understanding and provides extra credit work for those who does bad on the quizzes but overall her class is manageable.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: I took this course in the summer, and it seemed to be a lot of busy work. While I learned a lot from the mandatory readings, I feel it was unnecessary. The first test was a lot harder than the second. Discussion boards required an immense amount of thought. All in all, taking the course in class rather than online will most likely be less work.

I enjoyed Professor LeFebvre! The course was super easy, all quizzes were open book, and she dropped the lowest one. With the discussion posts, you are given the choice of two topics and I always make 100% on them, plus the lowest is dropped. I would definitely take a course with her again.

The class wasn't too bad. Her lectures are powerpoints that you have to take notes on, and then she has additional reading that she goes over in class. (I didn't buy either of the books) Her tests were pretty hard though. Our class average for the midterm (midterm and final are only tests) was in the 70's. One group project but it wasn't bad.

She is a really sweet prof. She always had a smile on her face. As for her lectures, they're easy to follow along with and consistent with information in the textbooks. As long as you take notes on the lectures, show up for class, and participate in the group stimulation, you'll be okay in the class. She is always willing to answer questions too!
Great Prof. Just study from her ppt and study guide for exams, and you'll get an A. Simulations are fun and interesting.

Dr. L is a phenomenal professor for Global Issues. Her lectures are interesting and relevant to things that are going on in the world right now. She is great at being unbiased. Her class is really easy if  you show up and pay attention. Her class is very interactive, so I really enjoyed it.

An amazing teacher!  I had no idea what to expect of this course but was pleasantly surprised by her. There are no quizzes or tests, just a few papers, 4 homework assignments, and a group project. The class was interesting and i got a lot out of it. I highly recommend her
